# Coding Challenge

Our platform (Heroku) splits log messages after 10000 characters. Write a script that concatenates the split lines. You will write a script to recombine those lines.

```
# Example of a standard log message
2022-06-27T13:49:36.688264+00:00 app[web.2]: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

# Example of a split log message
2022-06-27T13:49:36.689142+00:00 app[web.2]: 
2022-06-27T13:49:36.689142+00:00 app[web.2]: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
```

### Link to example file:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rbxLSCWPGXp8wE9ZklxPkTFJ71bvppEl/view?usp=sharing

### Lines with >10000 Characters:

- 5523
- 8246
- 43473
- 43675
- 46812
- 47068
- 52521

### Your script should

- Accept as a parameter the path to a `.log` file to be parsed
- Identify and concatenate lines that have been split back into the original log message
- Output (to a file or `stdout`) all of the lines, concatenated where necessary
- Concatenate the split lines back into the original log message
